p: Another producer strain called Gluconacetobacter xylinus PTCC 1734 growing on a CW hydrolysate medium for 14 days, produced a comparatively higher BC concentration of 3.5 g/L [ 79]. Moreover, the bacterial strain K. rhaeticus P1463 produced a higher concentration of BC (6.55 g/L) by growing on CW hydrolysate medium for 14 days [ 67, 80].
